intro: Erpetion reniforme, commonly known as the kidneyleaf, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly referred to as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its kidney-shaped leaves, which are typically smooth and have a slightly hairy texture. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or white in color. Erpetion reniforme thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats.
